name: Onam
title: Harvest Festival of Kerala
description: Onam is the most important festival of Kerala, celebrating the homecoming of the legendary King Mahabali. It's a ten-day harvest festival that showcases Kerala's rich cultural heritage through various traditional activities.
significance: Celebrates the homecoming of King Mahabali and the harvest season, symbolizing prosperity and equality.

seo.description: Complete guide to Onam festival with Onam Sadya, boat races, Kathakali, Pulikali, and traditional celebrations. Learn the significance of Kerala's harvest festival.

sections.title: Welcome to Onam
sections.content: Onam is Kerala's most vibrant festival, celebrating the golden age of King Mahabali's reign and the abundance of the harvest season. It's a time when Kerala comes alive with colors, traditions, and joy.

sections.title: Historical Significance
sections.content: Onam has ancient origins and is deeply rooted in Kerala's cultural and agricultural traditions. The festival celebrates the concept of equality and prosperity during King Mahabali's rule.

sections.title: Famous Stories
sections.content: The legend of King Mahabali forms the heart of Onam celebrations.

subsections.title: King Mahabali's Story
subsections.content: King Mahabali was a benevolent demon king who ruled Kerala with justice and equality. His growing power concerned the gods, who sent Lord Vishnu in his Vamana (dwarf) avatar to end his reign.

subsections.title: Vamana Avatar
subsections.content: Vishnu appeared as a dwarf Brahmin and asked Mahabali for three paces of land. When granted, Vamana grew to cosmic size, covering the universe in two steps and placing his third on Mahabali's head, pushing him to the netherworld.

sections.title: How Onam is Celebrated
sections.content: Onam celebrations span ten days with various traditional activities.

subsections.title: Onam Sadya
subsections.content: The traditional Onam feast (Sadya) is served on banana leaves with over 26 dishes, including avial, thoran, olan, and payasam.

subsections.title: Snake Boat Races
subsections.content: Exciting snake boat races (Vallam Kali) are held in backwaters, with hundreds of rowers synchronizing their movements to traditional songs.

sections.title: Rituals and Traditions
sections.content: Onam rituals include traditional practices that have been passed down through generations.

subsections.title: Pookalam
subsections.content: Colorful flower carpets (Pookalam) are created in front of houses for all ten days, growing in size and complexity each day.

subsections.title: Onathappan
subsections.content: Triangular clay figures representing Mahabali and Vamana are placed in the center of Pookalam as part of the worship.

sections.title: Onam Special Foods
sections.content: Onam Sadya is the highlight of the festival with its elaborate spread.

subsections.title: Traditional Dishes
subsections.content: The Sadya includes dishes like Erissery, Avial, Thoran, Olan, Kalan, Pachadi, and various types of pickles and papad.

subsections.title: Desserts
subsections.content: Traditional desserts include Ada Pradhaman, Palada Payasam, and various types of Kheer prepared with coconut milk and jaggery.

sections.title: Onam Bhajans
sections.content: Traditional songs sung during Onam celebrations.

subsections.title: Maveli Nadu Vaneerum
subsections.english:
When Maveli's country rules
Whenever feet come here
Forest sorrows disappear
Every limb shines with beauty
subsections.meaning: This traditional song welcomes King Mahabali and remembers his golden rule.

sections.title: Onam Aartis
sections.content: Traditional aartis performed during Onam celebrations.

subsections.title: Mahabali Aarti
subsections.english:
Aarti of King Mahabali
The aarti has become grand
Come come all together
Prepare for the celebration
subsections.meaning: This aarti celebrates the homecoming of King Mahabali.
